title: WOW, an afk in my promos?
body:
THANKS RIOT. that promo loss was 100% MY FAULT. im getting better already!!!! holy shit ive identified my mistakes that game... wanna know one of them? even trying. #1 game still cant seem to find a solution to 4v5ing ruining games. nice.

dont tell me that stupid "oh theres a chance you can win". im in diamond, we arent that retarded. we dont throw as hard as bronze and gold. mistakes are harder to act upon. so when you get an afk adc.. you cant win. period.

There was even some half-assed equation they like to throw around about how the enemy team has just as much chance to get an AFK as you so it doesn't matter.

ranked is kind of pointless, IMO. You get a nice shiny trim for everyone to see in that time where people go to the bathroom/grab food/smoke, a decent skin for gold and a summoner icon to add to the 34 or so you already have. It's hard enough to play with bad players, but the added pressure of knowing that 30-40 minutes of your life has been wasted due to a d/c or troll is too much. I ranked until gold (went to gold 3 for funsies), froze my LP at promos (it doesn't decay in promos) and got all the rewards I wanted with minimum stress.

Let's be real here, your rank in LoL is exactly that. It's a fictitious title in a game. You can't put it on your resume, and outside of the LoL community, it won't carry much of a conversation. I don't see why people get so upset over a game. Bragging rights? Compensation for "shortcomings? Play to have fun, but if it's causing you distress, stop.

Yeah, because while playing Normals the afk people are soooo much more understandable and less of a waste of 40 minutes. Right guys? Guys....?

I don't mean to burst your bubble, but some people find it fun to climb the ladder and improve at the game. Shocker, I know. You know what stops them from having fun? People that afk. You know what's worse then people that afk? People that try to defend afks with with weak pitiful arguments about "having fun. Why u heff to be med it only game" non sense.
